ai.summary: Gorge Trail is a short, 2.5 km hike in the UK suitable for beginners. The route follows a gorge riverbank along a well-marked path, offering accessible scenery and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily a well-maintained path along a gorge with gentle slopes. Expect occasional uneven ground, exposed roots, and some mud. The trail is overall easy and suitable for most walkers.
ai.safety_notes: - Check local weather before you go; conditions near water and in gorge environments can change quickly. - Wear sturdy, closed-toe hiking shoes with good grip. - Stay on the marked path and respect barriers; keep a safe distance from edges. - Bring a light rain jacket and warmer layers; the gorge can be cooler and damper than surrounding areas. - Carry enough water and a small snack; inform someone of your plans if hiking alone. - Be cautious on muddy sections after rain and avoid shortcuts. - Keep pets under control and clean up after them where required. - In remote UK locations, mobile signal may be limited; carry a map or offline navigation.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation on phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn generally offer the best conditions; the hike can be done year-round with proper footwear and weather gear.

seo.title: Gorge Trail Hike in the UK - 2.5 km Easy Gorge Walk
seo.meta_description: Discover Gorge Trail, a 2.5 km easy hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and gear for a short, scenic gorge walk.
